q1xtFVFPTHl3yVj9DKsL0A.text: Best to-go Mediterranean type food. Priced right and always consistent flavor and freshness. Vegan options available!!

4p60YzsyBp7tAZG4N0-now.text: I like to come here for the lunch special. Its a great deal for $10. I normally get the Mediterranean wrap and it includes a side salad, soup or rice, and it comes with a drink. The staff is always very friendly and the ambiance is nice.

54DcvyKZc7HapKdJBGew0A.text: $10 Lunch special! Worth $18 Amazing home cooked Greek cuisine,  impeccable service very comfortable environment! Must try!

GNSeRDuI_9IhIvUfPLbd8g.text: My wife and I have been going to the Durango location for years now. There are several reasons that we keep coming back.  First the staff, a family owned and operated business, they do a great job in ensuring you are taking good care of. I feel that once the team gets to know you, they basically know what your regulars are and will ask "your regular"? The team is always checking on you and ensuring small things like ensuring you drink glass is never empty, asking if your food is prepared correctly all while able to have conversations.   The food is always great. We have had several different dishes from pasta, steak and chicken and have never been disappointed. Food is prepared fresh and is always brought out hot. I feel the prices for the food are good and honestly we are always bring home leftovers. I would recommend the Gyros, they are awesome and remind me of my trip to Santorini.   The store recently went thru a renovation, and thou I miss the pictures of Santorini (Sorry Joe), they  did a great job updating the restaurant giving it a warm inviting feeling . What I think is unique is they have videos playing of highlights of the activities the restaurant is involved with.   If you on the fence about trying, I would highly recommend this local gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great pic as the sun sets over a great restaurant

Cp13OSVa9jRaI-hwLZ4qNQ.text: Absolutely loved this place! Great food and  ambience. Prices are fair and service was exellent our server was Chasey. A must try we definitely coming back!

us0cpycn7XhaGrhAv96dbw.text: Love this place! We've been eating here since their first location in Centennial Center. They've kept up the quality as they've expanded. It's become my favorite "comfort food" place, and now my family and my wife's family look forward to coming here when they come to town. The pomegranate chicken is a must-have if you've never eaten here before. Also love the mama mia's chicken, any of the skewers, the stuffed peppers... anything, really. I don't think I've ever had a bad meal here.

tNOpVI7ULB1GqHTCRMr4dg.text: We just get the hummus and the gyros everytime because they're so good. Love the punch cards! Reminds me to come in and I'm never sad about that.

oQCvp9f-JSS5z5qBnEk4jg.text: This was a great find not too far from our house.  So far two gyros (lamb and traditional) have been tried, along with some babaganoush, baklava, and roasted red pepper hummus.  All were really quite good.  My only quibble was that the hummus wasn't quite as thick as I'm used too and the babganoush was a little thicker, but both tasted good, which is what really counts.  They warm pita triangles were quite nice though.  Our takeout look a bit longer than planned as well (they said 10 min and it was closer to 20), but I'm willing to wait for good food, and this was really good food.  We'll definitely be back to this place in the future.

wgn4GA_qGvwX3pMcKz0WDA.text: Fresh Fast and Fun, Food good , I had  mousakka and my husband had Gyro and we enjoyed the taste and the freshness.  Coupon for free drinks ( wine) was a plus.  Service in a "semi-fast food " place was refreshing.  Aphrodite cheese cake as MARVELOUS.  We will go again!

UaBCvVjwAKX-B23fFh_Hlw.text: This food helps me so much with my new Mediterranean kick. They fill the holes where needed.   I am a plain jane, plain and simple kind of guy. So I will begin saying that their lunch specials ROCK! A Chicken Gyro or the Pomegranate Chicken salad is not only considered a healthy lunch but a tasty lunch as well. There are a couple items as well that are under their lunch specials and they're only 7.50.   Aside from the lunch specials there is a HUGE selection of Mediterranean favorites to choose from which I have yet to begin to explore but will because I am already sold on their food, product, atmosphere and service.  If I had an award for Champion of Local Small Business, Market Grille Cafe would be it. In both restaurants you will find televisions playing video of the Market Grille family and it really makes you respect the place for being a family business. In Las Vegas, a family business and even a restaurant being a family business is a hard thing to come by because barely any succeed. I remember as a teen eating at their first location off of Tropical Parkway and Centennial. They expanded and opened up a second location off of Lake Mead and Rock Springs. Next thing I know they relocated their original store to an old abandoned Chili's building off of Durango between Elkhorn and Deer Springs. I really hope these guys are doing good and hope they're having resulted success with business volume.  The only thing I could recommend to these guys is keeping everything the same. Distinguishing between both locations they do a very good job at that. However, the Centennial restaurant offers table service. There are servers, they serve on you and I would consider it a casual style dining. At the Lake Mead restaurant, you fill up your own drinks, pick your own table and the only thing delivered to you is your food and your silverware. BOTH ARE FINE, I AM IN THE INDUSTRY AND TIP REGARDLESS! But I think it would be more successful for Market Grille to pick a method of service and stick to it as opposed to it being differentiated between both restaurants. There are penny pinchers that could be scared away from this location because they are accustomed to the style of service they receive at the Lake Mead and Rock Springs location.  They're friendly, the product is fresh and some could see it as a little pricy. Deal with it, because you get what you pay for. The service is awesome, the food is consistent and their PUMPKIN BAKLAVA CHEESECAKE is amazing.   Keep strong Market Grille, I'll see you soon!

awbRIlEujWnSjvjpAGsXjg.text: Excellent Food. Excellent Service. I ordered food to go, and one very kind employee offered us a sample of all their soups while we waited for our order. Doesn't get any better than that! ;)

xlHHQnY2iEfIuqRfVFLAfw.text: Horrible customer service. I went to pick up an order and the girl at the counter didn't acknowledge me until I said something. She then apparently forgot I was waiting there because she was getting confused about someone else's order. Very incompetent. I mean I could understand if you feel flustered sure, but this girl was rude about it when I asked for an update on my food that I called 15min ahead of time. I'd rather go to their other location.

FVQedHi3nL2cy8WxdqUn0A.text: Altogether a fabulous experience.  From the friendly and professional waitstaff to the beautiful atmosphere to the food, this is a great place to eat at - or takeout food.  I had the pumpkin mushroom soup (AMAZING!), pumpkin baklava cheesecake (pumpkin cheesecake with baklava chips on it and crust - OH MY!), the vegetable skewers and veg-a-nini (lots vegetables - great for vegetarians and vegans).  Also, the owner is always there and says hi, which is nice.  I can't wait to try it again!

E4NEnZPw9RGdaVB35QrWdA.text: My husband and I have frequently visited (several times a week) Market Grille since the "olden days" when there was only one location and it was near Tropical Pkwy/89131.  The food and service and staff have consistently been great.  If you want a positive dining experience, please try EITHER Market Grille Cafe.  :-)  Thank you, Joe and Rhonda, and the family and staff!!!

6CnZpsLnmilypOQ6cBq63w.text: Absolutely the best lunch I have ever had! The wrap and salad was incredible! My husband had the gyro and agreed it was the best he has ever had! Great service too! The price was great for the amount of food! I will definitely be eating here as much as possible!!

Ln4UtUJajSK-WVekf5YFWA.text: A wonderful family run restaurant! Loved our entire experience. From the very personable waiter (who took the time to share the story of the business), to the great fresh made food! Felt the "culture" of the restaurant was very generous and hospitable. We will certainly return!

pfbHzhVN2898sLdQql99ew.text: We LOVE the food here, it's great, we just had our daughter's graduation here and it was awesome. Everyone is always very nice and friendly too. Thank you so much.

0VoIzANre0IadnAAwV3fZA.text: Simple and good food and very fair prices - love eating here.

aOei6NLqqp5Vb808n1d2sg.text: Had the mousaka here and it was delicious! The portion size was great and a good price. Their ingredients seemed fresh. It is a small place but nice open seating. Self Serve Drinks.  The menu at the counter where you order is actually on the ceiling so it wasn't easy to read.  I've also tried the appetizer sampler and the pomegranate chicken at a different location (Lake Mead) and that was great. Good for sharing. Oh also had their salad (part of entree combo) and I Loved it!  Good pricing, good portion, and great service. (order at the counter and it gets brought to  your table)  I've been craving their hummus and pita and mousaka for a while, I need to go back! But too many options for food during the holidays.

GxfmRspJkZzxgg4eL8XkMQ.text: Changing to 1 star.  This place lost a customer over $7.00.   My wife has been frequently going to this place on her own before and after work for at least the last year and change. Last week, she went there and ordered a meal that included dessert for take out.  She didn't like the dessert and went back the next day and approached a server that helped her several times previously.  The server refused to take back the dessert and told my wife that if she wanted to get something else, there would be another charge!! On top of things, my wife had just placed another order for more food prior to bringing this dessert situation to their attention!  My wife swiftly told the server to cancel her order and said walked out.  We are talking about a $7.00 dessert that virtually costs the restaurant nothing.  Even if it costs $20, the restaurant, should have acknowledged the fact that my wife didn't like it, apologize, and offered a refund or an exchange since we are frequent customers.  We will definitely not be returning as a result.

Ze_abZ6JCUGOJ6sqPx3B-w.text: Had the Saganaki, Platos potatoes, & Falafel Gyro was very good and the service was alright. I would go back.

teE5ENaY73haNo6AHp4EIw.text: Really love this place.  A favorite in the Centennial Hills area.

Z_2w7Icd-tvoyrKdtoLa3w.text: I cannot believe I have never checked this place out before!  The decor is great, and the food and service are amazing. My wife had the Pomegranate Chicken entree and I had the Stuffed Tomatoes entree. They were both excellent, and served to us very quickly. We will certainly be back again!

bcYDQYV1FCBsTJxsbJHiPw.text: We got off the freeway passing by Las Vegas and found the perfect lunch spot. This is the outback steakhouse of Greek Food, meant in a totally positive way! Terrific and fun decor, friendly staff and wonderful food.  We had lamb slouvaki Gyros, scrumptious. Owners and staff were welcoming and very friendly. Very clean restaurant. Recommended!!

FqowfyjmlmqXGdL7LaUgmA.text: I really like the freshness of Market Grill and how it's all homemade.  We really can't say that much here in Las Vegas!    What I always get:  Dolmades- dip them in the hummus that comes along side-HEAVENLY!  Falafel with Satziki on pita bread with a spike of hummus or babaganoush-True love :)  The babaganoush is terrificly garlicky-soo addictive, don't plan on kissing anyone for a while!  My total bill comes to around $30, but I make it last through about 3-4 lunches!   If you are a fan of Greek, try it-you won't be sorry!

ibS-JHnQ2OHW8iMzA6N1NA.text: Awesome food and such down to earth, kind owners!!! Best Greek food in the area-consistently delicious!!!

yLke5NHohUH2eu7aEDfQ6A.text: This was my third time eating at Market Grille Cafe with the hubby.  The verdict: we're fans! This family-owned restaurant is well decorated to showcase Greek culture and food. The Greek music playing in the background and occasional cries of "Opa" by the staff make the dining experience feel more authentic.    My personal favorites thus far are the platos potatoes,  $4.25, which are served with a taziki sauce and garnished with feta cheese and seasonings, and the stuffed tomato entree dish for $11.75.  The stuffed tomatoes are packed with flavor and have some serious weight to them. I was only able to finish one! The tomatoes are served with a small salad,  rice, and pita bread with hummus.    Our server was super friendly and the wait time for our food was reasonably short. On this particular visit we happened to have a Groupon,  so we got a delicious meal for about $25 after everything.  Groupon or not, we'll be back!

Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad that comes with entrée plate
Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed tomatoes

_h_aQGQTaYoA0ye6PYjoNw.text: A usual "go to "for a "to go" order! Such a great alternative if you eat later at night (like me) and aren't a fan of fast food all the time...   I order take out here quit often. The staff is very friendly and attentive in making sure you receive the correct order. The owners seem to be pretty involved which is quite nice!   The salads and appetizers are amazing. The Dolmades & Greek salad is what I usually get and it's always so fresh, even the next day! My boyfriend usually gets their Mamma Mia Chicken which is excellent & comes with hummus + pita bread & a Greek salad. Cheap price for delicious noms.   Time frame for orders is very quick as well. I usually call in my order and by the time I drive from my house to the restaurant (10-15 minutes) my order is ready to go!   Double thumbs up for this place!

vlmodqaeoxR0Mv1BZowtbg.text: My dad has been dying to try this place out for a few months. He peeked inside before and thought it looked really cute. It is! The inside is decorated with a nice warm inviting feel. The tables have beautiful large photos of the Greek coastline, and I love the grill in the center of the room.  The menu has your standard Greek fare. Most items can be ordered a la carte, which comes with just rice, or as an entree, which then comes with rice, salad, hummus, and pita. If you have a smaller (ie, normal) sized appetite, the a la carte will be just fine. Dad and his gf enjoyed the lamb kabob and mousaka, and bf and I shared a gyro wrap and a lamb gyro. Wish the gyros had a bit more tzatziki but the flavor was good and the meats very tender.  Service was quick and friendly. It was a packed house on a Sat night and we got our food really fast.  The patio looks really cute too but it was close to 20 degrees tonight, so maybe next time!

dr2vKq7GuLBh4dvwzd8JTQ.text: Very good Greek food. Their soup is delicious. My favorite is the Spanakopita entree. Have not tried anything I did not like.

kGX-QvdjdcNGB3Ovnhptsg.text: Why advertise your vegetarian & vegan options when in reality, they are quite limited...  Salads do NOT count & we usually eat hummus/baba ganoush at home, anyway.  Lady on the phone had to check the actual vegetarian/vegan-ness of every option- kinda frustrating when I am used to "Mediterranean/Greek" style food always having tons of options for me. Usually I can just ask for no yogurt or no cheese. I appreciated the honesty & the helpfulness, because I genuinely have dairy allergies & don't want to risk it.  We decided not to order, because we were hungry & needed a substantial meal (not just appetizers).  That said, I think it is a really, really, REALLY bad decision to add feta cheese to your falafel, because I know a lot of us vegans go for it on a pita on the weekly & I doubt your omnivores would genuinely miss it. It's not usually used, in my experience.  Why reduce your clientele over something that is usually "accidentally" vegan?

VC5Xr6TWYCeCJ7k3E36lBw.text: Quality food and service with a smile. Fast seating and good selection. Great for families or couples looking for a lunch spot. Greek and Italian dishes. I love the gyro of course! Close to my home. Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ow3vG3kfGVe68bPlm7-VJA.text: Great experience & loved the food. I highly recommend this place. I mostly focused on the Greek food & it was very good. They also have Italian food options & my guess it's good too.

kYtdOa52cZHIGpjMhtmakQ.text: I used to absolutely love this place back before they got their own building.  We went here often, and it was always amazing.   Once they moved to the new (current) location, it seems they changed the recipes.  It's still consistent, but not as amazing as it used to be.  I don't know of a better Mediterranean restaurant in this area, it's not bad food at all, I just miss some of the old recipes.  I

-X1x-TghGB-OF_B64s0XIQ.text: GREAT food, great atmosphere. Always great service here when we come. Good pricing and good lunch specials as well. I love this place, me and my girlfriend come here quite often!

LGZDeGnpzHLa8JugKnNzIA.text: Ordered for pick-up last week when we were feeling lazy but not feeling greasy food. This place is amazing. The to-go person over the phone was super friendly and made the order easy, best part, it would be ready in 10 minutes.   They have cute little separate to-go area complete with waiting area. Our food was ready and fresh and was SO good.   Even better - the price was perfect.  Found our new to-go spot  :)

bi54wOgxqN9EM0zb1NlnQA.text: Thinking about the food here makes my mouth water. My boyfriend loves Greek food. We've gone to other restaurants, but never fell in love with the food.   This establishment is one of two locations and family owned. If the owner is there, he will personally greet you to see how your experience is.   I almost always order the 4 dolmades and Mamma Mia's Chicken! It is my favorite. Otherwise, the pomegranate chicken is another go to dish. And if we want to indulge a little bit, a cheesecake, rice pudding, or the baklava are amazing!

NVKt-fqHyhBT9-o9-B3PHg.text: When I'm in the mood for some Greek food, this is the place I go. The food is great and the personnel is very nice.

U8mWceCh39DEvB4GjBlAIg.text: MMmMm! if im craving for greek food, this is the place to go if you live in the North West area!  theres not many good restaurants up here but this is a good family restaurant! Hummus and pita bread was spot on.  Its a big portion and well worth the price. I definitely would come back here.

OSUkMwbCNLEJaCiKE1K9Qg.text: Yak! Just did not like food. The appetizer plate was ok but not great. I ordered chicken with pomegranate. It was sickening sweet. It's said fresh pomegranate which normally is tart. This was like a thick glaze. Think jelly like. Hubby had a trio of different Greek casserole type meals like moussaka. He said it was ok. $60 and I'm hungry 1 1:2 hrs later. Won't go back

DxmxJia946N_hMxy_dMndA.text: Good food. Good service. This is a great lunch and dinner restaurant. The Platos Potatoes are addictive. The leftovers, if anything makes it, are great the next day.

HAXCsznvnXuydcemIhIXow.text: It was a cloudy day and I needed spaghetti.  Of course it could have been sunny and I would've wanted spaghetti but I digress.  There are times when even on vacation you want some comfort food and for me that's spaghetti.  I've had my fair share of it at a ton of places.  I like to compare.  Usually the taste, the type of sauce, taste of the sauce, is there even enough sauce? You know the basics.  Also if they have them with meatballs, sausage or meat sauce.  With me the type of meat is usually the only thing that differs.   I proceeded to get the spaghetti with meatballs.  Time for some comfort!! Now this is a Mediterranean place so there is also a lot of Greek food which I'm sure is also delicious! Anywho when the waitress brought my plate I was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't a huge dish. Because as much as I love spaghetti sometimes you just get full.  My plate also came with pieces of pita bread which were awesome! Only downside was that there wasn't enough sauce. I usually like a lot of sauce but it tasted great so not really a downside. The meatballs were small and just a bit dry but it was a mix of beef, veil and another meat I can't remember.  But they were also delicious.   All in all I was happy with their spaghetti!! I also decided to have the rice pudding!! Omg it was delicious!! It was smooth and creamy with cinnamon on top, which I'm not a fan of cinnamon but it paired so well with the rice pudding.  Like I have said before the best way to eat is like a local!!

photos.caption: Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti
Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interesting

7MD7uBqmGub7hMsMU158EQ.text: New to Las Vegas from LA and dining out while our frig is being delivered.  Made it a point to come here tonight and wasn't disappointed at all.  In fact during the introduction of MGC's history and food preparation my mouth just started watering.  I chose the Lamb Roast Cabernet and really the best lamb (pulled for that matter) I've ever tasted in my life.  Reasonably priced and their atmosphere with live music is just made my evening.  Strong tips to the musician and MGC as it was a good introduction to how Vegas suburbs is so mellow. Definitely coming back to check out the rest of the menu since they're only 5 minutes away from my new home.   MGC.  Did I say MGC just beat out the Persian way of cooking lamb.  Well, I did now.

7x1Fwr_i8OLHSFtUlcQnsQ.text: The food is really good, so my husband and I return frequently.  Plus, it's close by.  BUT, it has been three times now and I've asked for no onions in my wrap and they put onions in my wrap!  The first time, the OWNER told me I must have mistaken them for the red cabbage.  I am 1000% confident I did not mistake them (I think I can tell when my throat starts to feel tingly).  Plus, I frequently use red cabbage in my own cooking.  The owner still made us pay for the meal.    The most recent time was a take-out order.  I must have said 10 or 20 times "no raw onions" in either of the two orders, and asked several, "are you sure there are no raw onions?" before I left.  As soon as I got home, I took a giant bite and behold- there were onions in both orders.    Further.  Before you leave the take-out area, they quickly open the box to make sure the order is correct.  The server who opened the box saw that one of the wraps looked like it had fallen on the ground and was no longer a wrap.  Yet, he closed the box again as if I was going to take it.  They also forgot multiple things on my order and I ended up waiting even longer for the order to be refilled (45 minutes).

AtTz3yikVfEk5tV0X4kyng.text: The food is excellent here. The service is great and the staff keeps you up with the status of your food and service. Definitely worth paying a little more than usual for Greek food. Worth a visit for great Greek food!

photos.caption: Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyro in a spinach wrap with Greek salad.

IFvwIgMeitG09WGhkz9YGA.text: My families favorite place to come for lunch and dinner.  N. Durango location. Everything is delicious and made fresh. Yum!!    Great pumpkin soup! Delicious spanakopita. Hummus, veggies, etc etc. there are vegetarian options on the menu.   Must try the Tiramisu cheesecake....omg so so good. I wish I had taken pictures to share but I couldn't shovel it in fast enough. Haha.

taVFclFcI4J0w3lOwVZp2w.text: Ambiance was great... a very talented singer/piano player was softly playing in the background at this lovely restaurant.   My hubby really enjoyed his Chicken Marsala. However, my Pomegranate Chicken (supposedly award winning, but the obnoxious waitress could not tell me what award was won), was a big disappointment. A tiny piece of dry chicken was barely saved by not-enough pomegranate sauce. The award winning (again, no specifics) cheesecake was not to my liking at all.  I definitely plan on going back to see if Market Cafe can earn another star with a different entree, as I enjoyed our visit and I like to support the locals.

RgCQyz3bPEI2THsxmvXIxQ.text: Wow wow wow.....we have lived in this area for roughly 3 years and have overlooked this gem numerous times. This is an amazing Greek restaurant perfect for anytime and any occasion! My sister and I decided to try this place on a whim and we were very pleased at the decor and ambiance of the place as soon as we walked in. We were also pleasantly surprised to see a live singer/guitarist on the stage singing a mixture of cover songs. Now for the good stuff, the food! I ordered an appetizer the stuffed grape leaves vegetarian style and the spanikopita entree, it comes with hummus/pita bread, Greek rice and a side salad. The grape leaves were not only delicious but HUGE! I was pleasantly surprised by this. Seeing as the appetizer was so huge I expected my spanikopita to be a good side. However I was disappointed it not only was smaller than expected but I have had better.....I got a corner piece and the sides were a little over done. Still however the rice was good very flavorful and the hummus was your basic hummus. My sister got the eggplant parmesan and a side of fries. Her eggplant parmesan was very dissapointing....it was good I guess but the two slices you got we're a joke. I believe it was suppose to be served on a bed of pasta which my sister did not want so maybe that's why they are so little. The fries were amazing! They were crispy on the outside but not over cooked very very good. I'd go back just for those. Also she got the rosemary pita bread and it was fantastic!!! I'm shocked they even serve the plain!  Lastly we both got the baklava cheesecake, and it was NOT my style! I am a tradition cheesecake girl and the flavors too me just did not go. Will not get that again! But the other desserts looks really good. All in all I would recommend this spot and I'm curious to try the other things on the menu. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot coffee
Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spanikopita entree
Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rosemary pita so much flavor!!!

-9KC5fekXt_OldXH_mgajQ.text: Before I tried this place my parents absolutely loved it. So when the time finally came I tried it. I'm not gonna lie it was pretty good. The place was really nice, the decor was nice and the workers were great.  So food wise, I ended picking a Mediterranean wrap with Pomegranate chicken (which was highly recommended by my parents) and I will say this, it was great dish. It had pomegranate chicken of course, red onions, lettuce, tomato, and hummus. With a side Greek salad.  Both of the dishes were great but the only downside were the tomatoes. The tomatoes we diced and all but they were big. It was to the point where I had to pick them off because they were so big. So another thing with the wrap was the hummus. There was so much hummus in the wrap and it was to the point where I just really couldn't eat it anymore. Almost every bite a took I just got a big mesh of hummus. Maybe is the spread it more and add a little less. But overall it was a great dish. Definitely would come back again and get something else

photos.caption: Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AS2asj3m1MpPyPaeCvpKeQ.text: Yum yum yum yum yum yum yum yum! This places is delish!! I found it while house hunting in the Skye Canyon area and so glad I did!! Can't wait to be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids chicken gyro with Greek salad.

26e4kisfJAbDKuCtuhIIYw.text: So I told my husband about this place after I grabbed lunch last week. I had the chicken skewer meal and was very impressed. The chicken was juicy and flavorful.  I decided to grab dinner tonight so he could try it and was extremely disappointed. My chicken skewer was dry and burnt, leaving a terrible after taste. His steak skewer was also overcooked and lacked flavor. He actually asked if it was supposed to come with a dipping sauce because it was so dry. The veggie skewers and salad were however tasty. Ultimately I ended up throwing out an entire chicken skewer (I ordered an extra one) and giving my dogs the remainder of mine. My husband's meal is sitting on the counter and we are headed out to grab a burger. Disappointed I wasted $35.

i8sGZmItPVtwQBFSSJ8eQA.text: I am always looking for a good Mediterranean restaurant where the meat actually looks like it came from an animal because I have had a few experiences that were iffy. Market grille cafe delivers. They have a lot of authentic Greek dishes and a good amount of choices on the menu.   The Service: I sat and waited a few minutes while waiters and waitresses walked by before someone finally came and talked to me. I'm not really sure who my actual waiter/waitress was because I had 3 or 4 different people. One brought me water, another took my order, a different one brought my food and another brought me my check which threw me off a bit.  The Food: The steak skewer is supposed to be cooked medium BUT definitely came out medium well/ well done which isn't my favorite. Fortunately it was well seasoned and not too dry so I didn't complain (I hate being that person). The veggie skewer is once again well seasoned and the rice was too. The Greek salad was good, not too much dressing but also not underdressed. Overall, a good experience and the atmosphere is nice. They also have live music sometimes which I saw written on a board in there so if you're into that or just need a Mediterranean fix then this is a good place to give a chance.   Updated to 4 stars. I went again and the service was much better, my food was also cooked correctly and nice and juicy. I also sat outside this time and it is a really cute little area. Nice if you would like to enjoy the weather but also shaded a bit so you aren't directly in the sunlight. No complaints and will go again for lunch since it is right by my job!

photos.caption: Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Full size Greek Salad no onions
Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak skewer (once again sorry for bad lighting)
Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside Patio area

Qw6wIatdP5ymGNghph1_1Q.text: If I could give this place more than 5 stars, I WOULD!!!   After visiting the shooting complex, my husband and I decided to go have some lunch, being from Henderson, we didn't know the area too well so we looked on Yelp and found this place, it did not disappoint!!  We started off with the Lemon Cilantro Hummus which is served with Pita Bread and it's a very good shareable portion. My husband and I like to order 2 different plates and share them. We decided on the Pomegranate Chicken and the Vasilios Platter, no regrets at all!!  The Pomegranate Chicken, TO DIE FOR!!! The chicken is juicy and tender. It's marinated with pomegranate juice and grilled to perfection!! It's topped with a pomegranate glaze and served with chopped Walnuts. I ordered the entree so it came with Basmati rice, a side salad and some hummus.  The Vasilios Platter is served with lamb-beef (gyro meet) we couldn't get enough!!! All my husband and I talked about was how good the food was and what a great find this place was!!   Confession... in a time frame if a week and a half... my husband and I have made the drive to come eat here, 3 times already! That should tell you how fantastic this place is!!!   We finally saved some room for dessert, I have no words to describe how amazing the Pumpkin Cheesecake was. This place just gets better every time we come!!!   I'll be bringing my family and in-laws here when they come visit. This place should not be missed!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vasilios Platter and The Pomegranate Chicken in the background
Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cilantro Lime Hummus served with Pita Bread
Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pumpkin Cheesecake

mPKHv5GI07Ns6On7iUTIKQ.text: My wife and I have eaten at the great restaurant many times it is one of our favorite places to eat. The location is very clean and modern. The staff is very friendly and attentive. And most importantly the good is delicious.

DMlygcfYQbcib8Uj1LQNKA.text: We actually have been coming to Market Grille Cafe since 2008 when it was at the previous location off of Tropical Parkway.  The food is always outstanding and the staff are really friendly.  It has a family atmosphere and we love bringing our children here.  The menu is really extensive and in the Fall time frame (Oct normally) they block off a portion of the parking lot for a festival where you can bring your kids.  Whether dining-in or take-out, the food is the same and delicious.  I have a picky family so it is difficult to find a good restaurant where they really enjoy the food.  This location hits their taste buds out of the park.    We've had their Chicken Skewer, Gyro with yogurt dill sauce, Pomegranate Chicken, salad, basmati rice, Tiramisu Cheesecake, and World's Best Dessert from their menu.  All are awesome and comes out just at the right temperature which means just above room temperature.  When we walk-in, we are immediately seated and our waitress is at our table in less then 15 seconds with the menu and ready to take our drink orders.  From the time we walk-in, seated, and leave, it is all within an hour.    For those who have a taste bud for some Mediterranean dishes at a very good price, this is the place for you.  It is located in the parking lot as a standalone building in a very large shopping mall with Smiths, TJ Max,  Dollar General, etc.

EmTPmMlDdzXBVd5zlOI5CQ.text: Was going for a work lunch run and tried their "chicken Greek bowl" for the first time and wow was it a rip off. $11 plus tax for a small container of 4 (literally counted 4) pieces of lettuce  ,tomato, onion, rice and some chicken. I could've gone to the great Greek place and got double of what they gave me for a dollar more then what I paid there. It was more of a kids bowl with adult price then a Greek bowl that's for sure

photos.caption: Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bxp1JGLprA8rL_bd56EA7g.text: We frequent this restaurant pretty often for lunch, and we ALWAYS get the saganaki cheese as an appetizer. Not only is the presentation great, it tastes amazing too. They also have lunch specials that are a pretty great deal, as well as a discount if you check in on Yelp! We love the staff every time we go as well. They are always super friendly and sometimes funny too! And when the weather is nice they have a lovely patio for outdoor dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saganaki on pita
Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Falafel wrap and Pumpkin - mushroom Soup
Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saganaki

5EiNBMy-e7wklFGYn_4qTA.text: I thought I had tasted fresh authentic Greek food...until I came here. . I was greeted and welcomed with a smile upon entering.  This is always nice. . I sat outside and on a hot day it was nice to have cooling misters out there!  Linda my server quickly came to bring water, answer my questions and take my order. . I ordered the hummus, baba ganoush, falafel, tabouleh, salad, dolmas and pita platter.   . Everything was 5 stars.  The real standout to me was the dolmas.  I got the vegan version.  The filling was just perfect!  The rice was light and fluffy and I could taste the fresh spices coming through.  There was even pine nuts in there!  The grape leaves were big and they weren't smothered in oil like a lot of others I have had. . The entire meal was DELICIOUS!  This review just made my mouth water.  I will go back for lunch tomorrow!

photos.caption: Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aACG7AZ62MVpfNTlZszwNA.text: This restaurant is locally owned and operated by family. All the food is made fresh with real ingredients. The customer service is always amazing and the owners walk around asking customers about their dining experience at their facility. I ordered the vegetarian stuffed tomato entree and it was filling and delicious. It took me 2 days to eat my meal lol! The pesto humus is The best! The Baklava was delicious! That took me 3 days to eat because it was so rich and decadent! Yummy! I can't wait to return to try something new!

photos.caption: Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baklava! Yummy!
Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed tomatoes!

U3jU3R_XyI1ZfpJ5Jf2MyA.text: To start with our server, Nicholas was extremely pleasant, courteous, and very attentive. The food is amazingly delicious with such good variety of items to choose from! Hubby and I will definitely come back again!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UBfhUULJq7RkJ8NsEvre2A.text: I've been here a few times. Today, I took a friend and we order the lunch specials. She had the pomegranate chicken and I had a Gyro. The pomegranate chicken was very flavorful and the fries were really good. My Gyro was good except, the pita bread always gets soggy. I recommend maybe ordering it on the side somehow & assembling it yourself. Because, every time I order it, it's always soggy.   For dessert, we decided to try the Tiramisu cheesecake. And we didn't like it that much. It didn't taste anything like Tiramisu. When I told this to the waitress... instead of apologizing she just made excuses which kind of made it worse. Although, she wasn't a bad waitress, she just wasn't that great. This service is just OK here.   Overall, this place is nice, nicely decorated with pretty good food, it's a pretty nice place.

photos.caption: Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Tiramisu cheese cake tasted nothing like the real Tiramisu. It was just OK.
Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute place.
Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice decorations!

QW15-e05qRbdCt4rH1ht8w.text: Amazing food and wonderful service! My husband had the Pomogranate Chicken, I had the Greek Trio - both were super yummy! And then we had to try the Tiramisu Cheesecake and that was just absolutely amazing ... Really glad we stopped by, we'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu Cheesecake

7VQE-mfZW0uiWcmrs2eTvA.text: This is my absolute favorite hummus in the entire town.  And if you haven't tried the Baklava cheesecake that they call Aphrodite's cheesecake then you have not lived. Although I must admit I prefer warm fresh Baklava with Vanilla Ice cream which they also serve and it is tremendous.   I've had a couple of their other dishes and they're all fine but I honestly come here for hummus and Pita and baklava. :)

XQdr6IsK4t5uj897pBYy3g.text: I went w a friend and her husband who is Greek. The ambiance is super cute, the back doors were open so the sunlight made it welcoming. However it did keep the place pretty warm.  We got he hummus and fried cheese, I wasn't a fan of either. Neither was my friends husband so that was a bummer. We both got the lamb gyro which was just ok, and my friend got the Giovanni which was really good!! If I decide to go back I'll get that or maybe try another pasta dish. We decided to get the baklava because of the reviews and so glad we did. Best I've ever had, Said all 3 of us!!  Service was great!

OVw4g6u6fiBfBs18MfJNKw.text: This is an awesome dinner option whether you're dining in or grabbing take out. The atmosphere when you eat in is great. They have so many good food options! My favorite is their Greek salad, so many restaurants skimp on the olives or feta they don't making it worth every penny. It's definitely on my favorites list for date night.

oh8FxPps4rJe3rSOd2EtAw.text: Great food, great atmosphere, and great service. Wish I could have tried a dessert, but was so full from the appetizer and entree. My friend ordered the appetizer, not sure what it was called, but it was melted cheese in olive oil and came with pita bread. If your a cheese fan I highly suggest it. The atomsphere was nice and laid back, if it was a bit cooler outside would have liked to sit out on the patio.

TYceAX0JyHd8UJ57BbhF5g.text: skewers are always the best! love their basmati rice! its not just plain but flavorful!   we always pick the one in Durango... ample seating!!!

BECRvgawjJXzYtkbM28m_g.text: Food is delicious. I had the Vegenini, it is like a vegetarian pizza. I loved it. The potato fries are also delicious. Customer service is always friendly.

FAdjfJYZmICPKaDznSZ4BA.text: This is a relatively new casual Greek restaurant that has prospered during these difficult times by providing very good food at reasonable prices.  Ann ordered the spanakopita while I chose the pomegranate chicken.  Entrees include pita bread, salad and Greek rice.  This version of spankopita was denser than we are accustomed to, but very good nonetheless.  I have only had pomegranate chicken once before at Paymon's and this version was infinitely superior.  I had a coupon printed off the restaurant's website good for 2 free glasses of wine that the manager accepted along with a discounted gift certificate purchased at Best Restaurant Guide.  We closed out the meal by sharing a piece of the restaurant's award winning Aphrodite cheesecake with a baklava crust.

photos.caption: Photo of Market Grille Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aphrodite cheesecake
